author: Dennis the Peasant, Monty Python and the Holy Grail
text: Strange women lying in ponds distributing swords is no basis for a system of government. Supreme executive power derives from a mandate from the masses, not from some farcical aquatic ceremony.

author: LOTR
text: Three rings for the Elven kings under the sky, seven for the Dwarf lords in their halls of stone, nine for the mortal men doomed to die, one for the Dark Lord on his dark throne, in the land of Mordor where the shadows lie. One ring to rule them all, one ring to find them, one ring the bring them all, and in the darkness bind them. In the land of Mordor where the shadows lie.

author: HAL, 2001: A Space Odyssey
text: I’m sorry, Dave. I’m afraid I can’t do that.

author: Dr. McCoy, Star Trek: The Motion Picture
text: TSpock. This child is about to wipe out every living thing on Earth. Now, what do you suggest we do….spank it?

author: Amazing Fantasy #15 (August 1962)
text: With great power there must also come — great responsibility.

author: Q, Star Trek: The Next Generation
text: If you can’t take a little bloody nose, maybe you oughtta go back home and crawl under your bed. It’s not safe out here. It’s wondrous, with treasures to satiate desires both subtle and gross; but it’s not for the timid..

author: Captain Jean Luc Picard, uttering the last line of the series, Star Trek: The Next Generation
text: Five card stud, nothing wild. And the sky’s the limit

author: Chris Knight, Real Genius
text: If you think that by threatening me you can get me to do what you want… Well, that’s where you’re right. But – and I am only saying that because I care – there’s a lot of decaffeinated brands on the market that are just as tasty as the real thing.

author: John Winger, Stripes
text: We’re all very different people. We’re not Watusi. We’re not Spartans. We’re Americans, with a capital ‘A’, huh? You know what that means? Do ya? That means that our forefathers were kicked out of every decent country in the world. We are the wretched refuse. We’re the underdog.

author: Ace Ventura, Ace ventura, Pet Detective
text: If I’m not back in five minutes, just wait longer.

author: Ty Webb, Caddyshack
text: I’m going to give you a little advice. There’s a force in the universe that makes things happen. And all you have to do is get in touch with it, stop thinking, let things happen, and be the ball.

author: God (Douglas Adams), So Long, and Thanks for All the Fish
text: WE APOLOGIZE FOR THE INCONVENIENCE

author: Adam West, Batman & Robin
text: Some days, you just can’t get rid of a bomb!

author: Ted, Bill & Ted’s Excellent Adventure
text: Bill, strange things are afoot at the Circle K.

author: Willy Wonka, Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
text: Invention, my dear friends, is 93% perspiration, 6% electricity, 4% evaporation, and 2% butterscotch ripple.

author: Slater, Dazed and Confused
text: Didja ever look at a dollar bill, man? There’s some spooky shit goin’ on there. And it’s green too.

author: Wooderson, Dazed and Confused
text: Alright, alright alright.
Heya, Tom’, it’s Bob from the office down the hall. Good to see you, buddy; how’ve you been? Things have been alright for me except that I’m a zombie now. I really wish you’d let us in.

author: Sheen, Jimmy Neutron
text: Never argue with the data.

author: Duckman (Jason Alexander)
text: Oooh right, it’s actually quite a funny story once you get past all the tragic elements and the over-riding sense of doom.

author: The Doctor (Christopher Eccleston), Doctor Who
text: Fantastic!

author: Bene Gesserit Litany Against Fear, Dune
text: I must not fear. / Fear is the mind-killer. / Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. / I will face my fear. / I will permit it to pass over me and through me. / And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. / Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. / Only I will remain.

author: Kramer, Seinfeld
text: This is the way society functions. Aren’t you a part of society?

author: Jack Burton, Big Trouble in Little China
text: Okay. You people sit tight, hold the fort and keep the home fires burning. And if we’re not back by dawn… call the president.
No matter where you go, there you are.
author: Buckaroo Banzai

text: Do you know of the Klingon proverb that tells us revenge is a dish that is best served cold? It is very cold in space.
author: Khan, ST:TWOK

text: Ray, if someone asks you if you’re a god, you say YES!
author: Winston, Ghostbusters

text: Greetings, programs!
author: Flynn, TRON

text: I guess you picked the wrong goddamned rec room to break into, didn’t you?!
author: Burt, Tremors

text: I find your lack of faith disturbing.
author: Darth Vader, Star Wars

text: Hokey religions and ancient weapons are no substitute for a good blaster at your side, kid.
author: Han Solo, Star Wars

text: Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda, The Empire Strikes Back

text: It’s a moral imperative.
author: Chris Knight, Real Genuis

text: Talk with your mouth full / bite the hand that feeds you / bite off more than you can chew / dare to be stupid
author: Weird AL, dare to be stupid.

text: Well, let’s say this Twinkie represents the normal amount of psychokinetic energy in the New York area. Based on this morning’s reading, it would be a Twinkie thirty-five feet long, weighing approximately six hundred pounds.
author: Egon, Ghostbusters

text: This episode was BADLY written!
author: Gwen, Galaxy Quest

text: Worst. Episode. Ever.
author: Comic Book Guy, The Simpsons

text: Goonies never say die.
author: Mike, The Goonies

text: Nothing shocks me–I’m a scientist.
author: Indiana Jones, Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom

text: Bright light! Bright light!
author: Gremlins

text: The Road goes ever on and on/Down from the door where it began/Now far ahead the Road has gone/And I must follow, if I can/Pursuing it with eager feet/Until it joins some larger way/Where many paths and errands meet/And whither then? I cannot say.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, Lord of the Rings

text: Human sacrifice, dogs and cats living together… mass hysteria!
author: Dr. Peter Venkman, Ghostbusters

text: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?
author: Albert Einstein

text: Wait a minute, Doc. Ah… Are you telling me you built a time machine… out of a DeLorean?
author: Marty McFly, Back to the Future

text: Don’t call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight blob of grease!
author: C3PO, Star Wars

text: I’d just as soon kiss a wookiee!
author: Princess Leia, The Empire Strikes Back

text: But one thing’s sure: Inspector Clay is dead, murdered, and somebody’s responsible.
author: Detective, Plan 9 from Outer Space

text: I know kung fu.
author: Neo, The Matrix

text: This is your receipt for your husband… and this is my receipt for your receipt.
author: Officer, Brazil

text: Your soul-suckin’ days are over, amigo!
author: Elvis, Bubba Ho-Tep

text: I don’t believe there’s a power in the ‘verse that can stop Kaylee from being cheerful. Sometimes you just wanna duct-tape her mouth and dump her in the hold for a month.
author: Malcolm Reynolds, Firefly

text: Would you say I have a plethora of piñatas?
author: El Guapo, ¡Three Amigos!

text: Never go in against a Sicilian when death is on the line!
author: Vizzini, The Princess Bride

text: There is no Earthly way of knowing… which direction we are going. There is no knowing where we’re rowing, or which way the river’s flowing. Is it raining? Is it snowing? Is a hurricane a’blowing? Not a speck of light is showing so the danger much be growing. Are the fires of hell a’glowing? Is the grisley reaper mowing? YES! The danger must be growing for the rowers keep on rowing AND THEY’RE CERTAINLY NOT SHOWING ANY SIGNS THAT THEY ARE SLOWING!!
author: Willy Wonka, Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory

text: Time…to die.
author: Roy Batty, Blade Runner

text: Now I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

text: Check, please.
author: Lone Starr & Barf, Spaceballs

text: So say we all.
author: Battlestar Galactica

text: After very careful consideration, sir, I’ve come to the conclusion that your new defense system sucks.
author: General Beringer, WarGames.

text: I am a leaf on the wind, watch how I soar.
author: Wash, Serenity

text: No matter what you hear in there, no matter how cruelly I beg you, no matter how terribly I may scream, do not open this door or you will undo everything I have worked for.
author: Young Frankenstein

text: Ahh, a bear in his natural habitat: a Studebaker.
author: Fozzie, The Muppet Movie

text: He’s dead, Jim.
author: McCoy, ST:TOS

text: Who’s gonna turn down a Junior Mint? It’s chocolate, it’s peppermint – it’s delicious!
author: Kramer, Seinfeld

text: Bring out your dead.
author: Monty Python and the Holy Grail

text: My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die!
author: Inigo, The Princess Bride

text: Why a duck? Why-a no chicken?
author: Chico Marx, Cocoanuts

text: Redrum.
author: Danny, The Shining

text: Who knows what evil lurks in the hearts of men? The Shadow knows.
author: announcer, The Shadow radio drama

text: We’re going to need a bigger boat.
author: Chief Brody, Jaws

text: Oooh, ahhh, that’s how it always starts. Then later there’s running and screaming.
author: Ian Malcolm, The Lost World: Jurassic Park

text: Greetings, my friend. We are all interested in the future, for that is where you and I are going to spend the rest of our lives. And remember my friend, future events such as these will affect you in the future.
author: Criswell, Plan 9 from Outer Space

text: Gentlemen, you can’t fight in here! This is the War Room!
author: President Merkin Muffley, Dr. Strangelove

text: These aren’t the droids you’re looking for.
author: Obi-Wan, Star Wars

text: Take your stinking paws off me, you damn dirty ape!
author: Taylor, Planet of the Apes

text: You maniacs! You blew it up! Oh, damn you! Damn you all to hell!
author: Taylor, Planet of the Apes

text: Klaatu barada nikto.
author: The Day the Earth Stood Still

text: Monsters from the Id.
author: Doc Ostrow, Forbidden Planet

text: ET phone home.
author: ET

text: What… is the air-speed velocity of an unladen swallow?
author: Bridgekeeper, Monty Python and the Holy Grail

text: We thought you was a toad!
author: Delmar, O Brother Where Art Thou?

text: Face it tiger, you just hit the jackpot!
author: Mary Jane, Spider-Man.

text: You don’t have to be a gun.
author: Hogarth, The Iron Giant.

text: Danger Will Robinson! Danger!
author: Robbie the Robot, Lost in Space

text: Yeah, well. The Dude abides.
author: The Dude, The Big Lebowski

text: All things serve the beam.
author: various instances, The Dark Tower series

text: You can’t fool me! There ain’t no Sanity Clause!
author: Chico Marx, A Night at the Opera

text: Like the fella says, in Italy for 30 years under the Borgias they had warfare, terror, murder, and bloodshed, but they produced Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci, and the Renaissance. In Switzerland they had brotherly love – they had 500 years of democracy and peace, and what did that produce? The cuckoo clock.
author: Harry Lime, The Third Man

text: And I said, I don’t care if they lay me off either, because I told, I told Bill that if they move my desk one more time, then, then I’m, I’m quitting, I’m going to quit. And, and I told Don too, because they’ve moved my desk four times already this year, and I used to be over by the window, and I could see the squirrels, and they were married, but then, they switched from the Swingline to the Boston stapler, but I kept my Swingline stapler because it didn’t bind up as much, and I kept the staples for the Swingline stapler and it’s not okay because if they take my stapler then I’ll set the building on fire…
author: Milton Waddams, Office Space

text: Michael, I did nothing. I did absolutely nothing, and it was everything that I thought it could be.
author: Peter Gibbons, Office Space

text: Now I have a machine gun. Ho ho ho.
author: John McClane (in writing), Die Hard

text: Gimme some sugar, baby.
author: Ash, Army of Darkness

text: Well hello Mister Fancypants. Well, I’ve got news for you pal, you ain’t leadin’ but two things, right now: Jack and sh*t… and Jack left town.
author: Ash, Army of Darkness

text: Kneel before Zod.
author: Zod, Superman II

text: Shall we play a game?
author: Joshua, WarGames

text: Daddy would have gotten us Uzis.
author: Samantha, Night of the Comet

text: It’s 106 miles to Chicago, we’ve got a full tank of gas, half a pack of cigarettes, it’s dark, and we’re wearing sunglasses."Hit it!"
author: Elwood, The Blues Brothers

text: Make it so
author: Captain Picard, Star Trek: The Next Generation

text: Ya Ta!
author: Hiro Nakamura, Heroes

text: End Of Line
author: The MCP, TRON
